intro: Clidemia lundellii, commonly known as the Hawaiian stiltgrass, is a species of flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Clidemia lundellii is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and streambanks.
